Articles.Content:
Right so there was an update to KSP.

I had 22 mods installed.

The transition to Curse left me without links for my mods again...

Yeah, in short it has come to the point where I need to ask for mods to get my KSP back in action, so my three saves will still function with all crafts inside.

Here's my mod list, it's only slightly out of date, but it's still mostly relevant:

Modulator Kolonization

Textures Reduced

Texture Replacer

Lazor Guided Weapons

Lazor System

Pirated Weaponry

Procedural Dynamics

Mechjeb

Hyperedit.

Magic Smokes Industries

Kethane

Kerbal Alarm Clock

Procedural Fairings

KAS

Extraplanetary Launch Pads

Environmental Visual Enhancements

Kerbal Engineer

Editor Extensions

DYJmisc Minigun

A Broken B9 (SABRE Engines don't work)

Boat Parts

I may post an image of my GameData folder with all the files I saved in it, so people can get an accurate assessment of my mods (And how F-ed up they might be be...)

Thank you in advance, this means a lot (It's why the move to Curse was a severe problem for me).

Find you mods here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/35-Add-on-Releases-and-Projects-Showcase

Here's a special thread in that forum, stickied, that should help:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55401-Community-Mods-and-Plugins-Library

Regex gave you everything you should need.

I am honestly curious about this situation though; Why did you take so long writing up a thread instead of using your preferred search engine and typing in those mod names pre/proceeded by KSP?

I am not trying to be rude or snarky, and would literally like to know the thought process that lead to this post.

Thanks in advance!

Yup. When i need to find a mod i find that the Mod name + KSP in google has never failed to bring up the Link to the forum post to the mod, which in turn has a download link =)

I think the only one on your list which is still on Spaceport and has not been updated is Pirated Weaponry

the DYJmisc Minigun is way out of date, Give Bahamuto's Weaponry a try!

Edited August 15, 2014 by rabidninjawombat

Regex gave you everything you should need.

I am honestly curious about this situation though; Why did you take so long writing up a thread instead of using your preferred search engine and typing in those mod names pre/proceeded by KSP?

I am not trying to be rude or snarky, and would literally like to know the thought process that lead to this post.

Thanks in advance!

Tried that, didn't end well.

That or I didn't search hard enough.

Ah, interesting. I find that when I put in any mod from my mod-list into Google and add the word KSP after, the thread or curse page is within the top 2 results.

Caveat to that though: If I don't know the name of a mod, or am looking for a new mod based off of function, Google doesn't help as much as the two links that regex posted.

Thanks for the reply btw =)
Spaceport was already unpopular when I started playing in February, so I got used to finding a mod's forum thread as the first step to finding where it was hosted and whether it was up-to-date.
